sources.title: "Flaming Waters" (1925) starring Malcolm McGregor, Pauline Garon
sources.description: This gem is presented by Silent Hall of Fame.   Please visit https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/   to support our non-profit mission and the legacy of silent movie stars by making a tax deductible contribution.   FEEL FREE TO FOLLOW US ON TWITTER @SilentFilmGems     This is a short preview. You can watch the whole film here: https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/index.php/gems-for-donation   "Flaming Waters" is a  fast-paced action drama. A sailor returning home finds out that an oil speculator has swindled his elderly mother out of her retirement money. He starts a quest to recover her lost savings.   Directed by               F. Harmon Weight Produced by             Associated Arts Corporation Scenario                      Frederick Myton from the story by E. metadata.Plot: After several years' absence, the young sailor Dan O'Neill returns to his hometown. He quickly discovers that his mother has been cheated out of her life savings by slick oil speculator Jasper Thorne and is now working as a charwoman. Dan tries to avenge his mother's loss by swindling the swindler.
metadata.Actors: Malcolm McGregor, Pauline Garon, Mary Carr
